title: Machine Learning Research Assistant
description: Conducted research comparing image segmentation algorithms and graph-based neural networks.
bullet_points: Compared image segmentation algorithms on maize leaf lesions and evaluated image-to-graph conversion approaches.
Built and trained GNNs using PyTorch Geometric on augmented datasets to compare against CNN baselines.
Implemented custom attention aggregation in Graph Attention Networks and benchmarked results.

title: Data Science / Software Developer Intern
description: Built an interactive image analysis tool to quantify skin hyperpigmentation aiding product research.
bullet_points: Designed and implemented a GUI using Matplotlib + Tkinter for interactive image review and measurement.
Integrated MediaPipe for facial landmarks and improved throughput using Python threading.
Packaged modular analysis scripts for handoff to product teams and presented outcomes to stakeholders.

title: Skin Disease Identifier Application (Team Lead)
description: Led a team building a mobile app to identify common skin diseases using computer vision.
bullet_points: Led a 12-person team through data collection, model selection, and mobile UI development.
Built the front-end in React Native and backend endpoints with Flask for model inference.
Integrated OpenCV and MediaPipe for image preprocessing and landmark detection.

title: Data Dive Competition – 2nd Place
subheading: Illinois Data Science Club · Urbana-Champaign, IL
description: Built an AI tool to provide feedback on oral presentations; placed 2nd out of 50 teams.
bullet_points: Designed 'Leo', a feedback system utilizing gaze-tracking and LLM-based analysis for presentations.
Implemented gaze-tracking using pretrained CNNs and used LLM embeddings for emotion/context analysis.
Coordinated dataset creation and prototype evaluation across multiple cohorts.

title: Agentic Healthcare AI Developer
description: Built an agentic system to retrieve cited medical information and generate preliminary diagnoses.
bullet_points: Created a Selenium-based scraper to gather source documents from MSDManual and other references.
Built a retrieval+LLM pipeline (BART & vector encoding) to provide cited, context-aware responses.
Validated retrieval quality and citation accuracy for downstream LLM prompting.

title: EdNet Dataset Exploration
description: Explored the EdNet dataset as part of a James Scholars project, expanding on skills used in class
bullet_points: Utilized Pandas to perform data cleaning in order to use dataset to answer a targetted question of interest
Applied Sklearn and Statsmodels regression algorithms to check for relationships between variabls of interest
Created an briefly summarized insights page, along with detailed documentation for the work
